name: Kim Il-sung Square
description: A grand public square that serves as a central location for parades and national celebrations. It is surrounded by important governmental buildings and offers a glimpse into the country's history.

name: Mansudae Grand Monument
description: Featuring colossal statues of Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il, this monument is a significant site for both locals and tourists. Visitors often pay their respects here and participate in the cultural practices surrounding the site.

name: Kumsusan Palace of the Sun
description: The mausoleum of Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il, this palace is an architectural marvel. Visitors can view the preserved bodies of the leaders, which are displayed in a ceremonial manner.

name: Arch of Triumph
description: Built to commemorate the Korean War, this arch is the largest of its kind in the world. It stands as a symbol of national pride and offers stunning views of the surrounding area.

name: Mount Myohyang
description: Known for its stunning natural beauty and rich biodiversity, this mountain is also home to the International Friendship Exhibition. The serene environment makes it a perfect spot for hiking.

name: Kaesong Koryo Museum
description: Housed in a former Confucian school, this museum showcases artifacts from the Koryo Dynasty. It provides insight into Korea's history and cultural heritage.

name: Myeonggan Pavilion
description: This picturesque pavilion is situated by the sea and is a tranquil spot to enjoy the coastal scenery. It offers a mix of natural beauty and cultural significance.

name: Sariwon Folk Village
description: A reconstructed traditional Korean village that showcases the lifestyle and customs of the Korean people. Visitors can explore traditional homes and participate in local crafts.

name: Pyongyang Metro
description: One of the deepest metro systems in the world, the Pyongyang Metro is known for its ornate stations and unique atmosphere. Riding the metro offers a glimpse into daily life in the capital.

name: Nampo Water Park
description: A popular recreational area featuring water slides and pools, this park is a unique way to experience leisure in North Korea. It's a favorite spot for families during the summer.

name: Korean War Museum
description: This museum offers an extensive look at the Korean War from the North Korean perspective. It displays military artifacts, historical documents, and a variety of exhibits.

name: Juche Tower
description: Standing at 170 meters, this tower symbolizes the Juche ideology. Visitors can ascend the tower for panoramic views of the city and learn about its significance.

name: Mangyongdae Native House
description: The birthplace of Kim Il-sung, this site is preserved as a museum. It offers a glimpse into the early life of the country's founder and the historical context of the time.

name: Wonsan Beach
description: A beautiful sandy beach on the east coast of North Korea, Wonsan Beach is ideal for relaxation and enjoying the sea. The area is less frequented by tourists, providing a peaceful escape.

name: DPRK Art Studio
description: This studio showcases the work of North Korean artists and provides insight into the country's artistic expressions. Visitors can observe artists at work and purchase unique pieces.

name: Mount Kumgang
description: Known for its breathtaking views and hiking trails, Mount Kumgang is a scenic region that attracts nature lovers. The area is rich with folklore and historical significance.

name: Koryo Hotel
description: One of the most famous hotels in North Korea, it features unique architecture and offers various amenities. Guests can enjoy stunning views of the city from their rooms.

name: Kim Jong-suk Memorial House
description: The memorial dedicated to the mother of Kim Jong-il, this site highlights her contributions to the revolution. It is a place of reflection for many North Koreans.

name: Baekdusan Mountain
description: Considered sacred in Korean culture, Baekdusan is the highest peak on the Korean Peninsula. It features stunning landscapes, including a crater lake and diverse flora.

name: Chollima Statue
description: This statue symbolizes the Chollima movement, which aimed to promote rapid economic development. It is an important cultural icon and is often featured in national events.

name: Pijong Pavilion
description: A historical pavilion that offers beautiful views of the surrounding area, it is a serene spot for reflection and appreciation of nature.

name: Tomb of King Dongmyeong
description: The burial site of the founder of the Goguryeo Kingdom, this tomb offers insight into ancient Korean history and is surrounded by beautiful landscapes.

name: Ryanggang Province Hot Springs
description: A lesser-known gem, these hot springs provide a relaxing experience amidst stunning natural surroundings. The area is tranquil and perfect for rejuvenation.

name: Chonji Lake
description: A picturesque lake located at the foot of Mount Baekdu, known for its clear waters and stunning scenery. It is a popular spot for picnics and leisure activities.

name: Korean Revolution Museum
description: This museum details the history of the Korean revolution and the country's leaders. It is an educational experience that highlights North Korea's narrative of its past.

name: Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Gardens
description: These beautifully landscaped gardens surrounding the mausoleum of Kim Il-sung are a peaceful retreat. They feature a variety of trees, flowers, and sculptures, ideal for leisurely walks.
